title:
Self-consistent theory of $2\times2$ pair density waves in kagome
  superconductors
authors: Meng Yao, Yan Wang, Da Wang, Jia-Xin Yin, Qiang-Hua Wang
abstract:
Pair density wave (PDW) is an intriguing quantum matter proposed in the
frontier of condensed matter physics. However, the existence of PDW in
microscopic models has been rare. In this work, we obtain, by Ginzburg-Landau
arguments and self-consistent mean field theory, novel $2a_0\times2a_0$ PDW on
the kagome lattice arising from attractive on-bond pairing interactions and the
distinct Bloch wave functions near the p-type van Hove singularity. The PDW
state carrying three independent wave-vectors, the so-called 3Q PDW, is
nodeless and falls into two topological classes characterized by the Chern
number $C = 0$ or $C = \pm2$. The chiral ($C=\pm2$) PDW state presents a rare
case of interaction driven topological quantum state without the requirement of
spin-orbit coupling. Finally, we analyze the stabilities and properties of
these PDWs intertwining with charge orders, and discuss the relevance of our
minimal model to recent experimental observations in kagome superconductors.
Our theory not only elucidates the driving force of the chiral PDW, but also
predicts strongly anisotropic superconducting gap structure in the momentum
space and quantized transverse thermal conductivity that can be tested in
future experiments.
